While players utilize their hands to maneuver the ball, strict rules govern their actions. Running with the ball is prohibited; instead, players must dribble, bouncing the ball on the floor as they advance. Once dribbling ceases, players must either pass the ball to a teammate or attempt a shot.

Understanding and adhering to these rules is crucial for success. For instance, taking more than two steps without dribbling constitutes a violation called "traveling," resulting in a turnover. Similarly, players must remain within the boundaries of the court. Stepping out of bounds or touching the line while possessing the ball grants possession to the opposing team.  Therefore, players must maintain focus on both the ball and their positioning on the court.

Basketball is a game of skill, strategy, and cooperation. Players rely on precise ball handling, teamwork, and constant ball movement to succeed. While they use their hands to control the ball, strict rules govern how they can move with it. 

Dribble, don't run! Players must bounce the ball on the floor as they move, a technique called dribbling. Once dribbling stops, they can either pass the ball to a teammate or shoot for the basket.  Remember, you can't start dribbling again after stopping.

Navigating the court requires careful footwork.  Taking more than two steps without dribbling, known as "traveling," results in a turnover.  Similarly, stepping out of bounds or even touching the line while holding the ball results in the opposing team gaining possession.  Therefore, players must maintain constant awareness of both the ball and their position on the court.
